function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited control of environmental conditions and confounding factors in natural history studies.","Impact":"Increased difficulty in accurately determining the influence of temperature and humidity on virus transmission.","Mitigation":"Use statistical techniques to control for confounding factors and conduct multiple studies in different environments.","Technologies":"Statistical modeling and data analysis tools.","People":"Researchers conducting natural history studies, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Mixed evidence and ongoing debate about the relationship between temperature and the spread of COVID-19.","Impact":"Uncertainty in understanding the influence of temperature on COVID-19 transmission.","Mitigation":"Continue conducting research to gather more data and evidence from different perspectives.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, epidemiological studies.","People":"Researchers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations, government agencies."},{"Description":"Influence of environmental factors such as temperature, humidity, and UV radiation on virus survivability and transmission rates.","Impact":"Difficulty in predicting and controlling the spread of COVID-19 based on environmental conditions.","Mitigation":"Conduct laboratory studies to understand the survivability of the virus under different environmental conditions and develop strategies to mitigate transmission based on environmental factors.","Technologies":"Laboratory equipment, data analysis tools.","People":"Researchers, public health officials.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."}]}
